result.execSummary:
The defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $500 has been applied. Remaining restitution to be repaid in monthly increments of no less than $50 starting November 1, 2015. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with T. or M. Pupeter and/or J. Gramza directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitiled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

records.addlTxt:
15CM220 & 15CM447 Cases called @ 2:31 p.m. Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM447: Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, N/C/C w/ his father G. Steffanides, Anger Managment and  follow through, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. 2 days CFTS. Appeal rights given.

15CM220 - Parties have received and reviewed the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be made. The parties stipulate to 118 days CFTS. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Zilles. No statement by DE. Court orders: Ct 1 - 7 mos WCJ - 118 days CFTS, Ct 3 - 7 mos WCJ concurrent - 87 days CFTS - Huber, GT. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-23-2016 03:15 pm

Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Zilles-requests more time. Court grants.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-10-2016 02:15 pm
from Atty Zilles requesting adjournment due to family emergency
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 01-21-2016 01:15 pm

Case called @ 3:35 p.m.  Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 3 - NC.  Repeater enhancer dismissed. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 2 & 4 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: Ct 1 only - 31 days WCJ - 31 days CFTS - Time served sentence. As to both counts - Restitution in the amount of $574.77 to T. and M. Pupeter, restitution to be repaid in increments of no less than $50 monthly starting November 1, 2015, NC w/ T. or M. Pupeter and/or J. Gramza, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA sample and surcharge. Bond previously posted to be applied to restitution. Appeal rights given.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  In lieu of posting the $500.00 Cash Bond, the Defendant will be permitted direct entry from the Waushara Co Jail to the Blandine House in Fond du Lac, WI to participate in the Residential Treatment at that facility.  Upon conclusion of the in-patient treatment at the Blandine House, the Defendant is to be returned to the Waushara Co Jail.  Transportation to and from the Blandine House to be arranged through DHS.

9:22 am case called. Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi states motion filed last week concerning bond and status of defendant.  Statement by Attorney Anderson regarding bond modification request. Further statement by Attorney Szilagyi. Court will amend bond.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  In lieu of posting the $500.00 Cash Bond, the Defendant will be permitted direct entry from the Waushara Co Jail to the NOVA Treatment Center in Oshkosh, WI to participate in the In-Patient Treatment at that facility.  Upon conclusion of the in-patient treatment at NOVA Treatment Center, the Defendant is to be returned to the Waushara Co Jail.  Transportation to and from NOVA Treatment Center to be arranged through DHS.

Case Called @ 11:29 AM: Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Per SPD:  DHS has arranged placement of Def and letter provided.  Cash Bond will likely not be posted.  Argues for amendment of bond as long as Def continues to follow the dictates of DHS.  Argument by ADA - believes controls for the situation would need to be placed to allow for structure.  The Court:  $500 Cash Bond to continue.  However will permit in lie of posting the $500 Cash, Defendant will be permitted direct entry to the NOVA Treatment Center in Oshkosh to participate in the In-Patient Treatment at that facility - direct from Jail to treatment facility.  Upon conclusion of in patient Defendant to be returned to WCJ.  Court will not currently permit placement in after care until further information is known as to program details of that after care.  Defendant will be released tomorrow from WC Jail.  Transportation will be arranged thru DHS.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 09:10 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:18 p.m. Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. ADA Anderson requesting high sig bond or low cash bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting signature bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 11:30 am.
